newsitem.title: USA: Harbinger buys Michigan co in $44 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Harbinger buys Michigan co in $44 mln deal.

text.p: Harbinger Corp said Monday it bought SupplyTech Inc, a supplier of EDI software and services, in stock deal valued at about $44 million.
Harbinger said it will take a first-quarter charge of $7.5-$10 million for acquisition expenses in the deal, which it said will be "accretive to earnings in 1997, exclusive of the charge."

Harbinger said it will issue 1.6 million new common shares in exchange for 100 percent of the privately-held Michigan company. Harbinger said it will have 13.5 million fully diluted shares outstanding after the issue.
EDI software, or electric data interchange software, is used in electronic commerce to connect large companies with their suppliers, trading partners and customers.
Harbinger said the merger makes it the second largest independent supplier of standards-based electronic commerce software and services in North America.
On a proforma basis, the combined companies had more than $60 million in revenue for the year ended December 31, Harbinger said.
Harbinger said the merger will be accounted for as a pooling of interests.
